step1.sentence: He stretched the truth a little when he told his friends he had single-handedly finished the project in one night.

step2.story: During the job interview, Maya stretched the truth when she claimed she had led a team of twenty people. In reality, she had only supervised two interns. She hoped the exaggeration would help her land the position.

step3.story: When Daniel returned from his weekend hiking trip, he gathered his coworkers around and began stretching the truth about the dangers he had faced on the trail. He described a bear encounter that had actually been nothing more than a distant rustle in the bushes. His colleagues listened wide-eyed as the story grew more dramatic with each retelling. By the time lunch ended, the bear had apparently chased him for half a mile. Daniel knew deep down that he was exaggerating, but the attention felt too good to stop.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 진실을 늘린다는 뜻으로, 사실을 실제보다 크거나 인상적으로 부풀리는 것을 의미한다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 거짓말까지는 아니지만 사실을 과장하거나 일부를 부풀려서 말할 때 사용한다. 주로 자신을 좋게 보이려 하거나 이야기를 더 흥미롭게 만들려는 상황에서 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'Stretch(늘이다)'와 'truth(진실)'의 결합으로, 고무줄처럼 진실을 필요 이상으로 늘려서 왜곡한다는 비유적 표현이다. 19세기 영어권에서 과장된 이야기를 묘사하는 데 널리 쓰이기 시작했다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 노골적인 거짓말보다 가벼운 뉘앙스를 띠며, 비교적 가벼운 과장이나 허풍을 표현할 때 사용된다. 상황에 따라 유머러스하게 쓰일 수도 있고, 상대방의 신뢰성을 살짝 꼬집는 비판적인 맥락에서 쓰이기도 한다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: She stretched the truth when she said the meeting lasted all day — it was only two hours.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그녀는 회의가 하루 종일 계속됐다고 했지만 사실은 두 시간뿐이었으니, 약간 과장한 것이었다.
